call_title: Faith, Trust, Proof of Work - Armeanio on the Social Layer of Decentralization | Ergo Meetup 2025

topics.title: Peer-to-Peer Networks and Social Trust Systems
topics.summary: Introduction to how decentralized systems mirror real-life communities with both technical parameters and social systems. Discussion of trust, belief, and faith in peer-to-peer networks as both beneficial entry points and potential attack vectors.

topics.title: Crypto Market Volatility and Risk Management
topics.summary: Discussion of recent market deleveraging events and billions removed from the market. Emphasis on the importance of risk management and proper understanding of leverage as a tool with trade-offs.

topics.title: Traditional Monetary Control Systems vs Crypto
topics.summary: Critique of centralized monetary policy where small groups control money cost and policy in secret rooms, with the world watching and positioning around their decisions. Contrast with Bitcoin's approach of set monetary policy parameters and building economy on set expectations.

topics.title: Building Public Goods and Open Source Development
topics.summary: Discussion of toxic social systems in crypto and the importance of building public, auditable, and extendable primitives. Uses SigmaUSD as example of research-based, open-source development that can be extended and improved over time.

topics.title: Proof of Work as Leaderless Coordination
topics.summary: Explanation of proof of work as a leaderless, apolitical coordination mechanism. Discussion of how decentralized systems should distribute skills and responsibilities rather than concentrate power in single leaders, with warnings about shepherd-sheep dynamics.

topics.title: Extended UTXO Application Trilemma
topics.summary: Introduction of Ergo's application trilemma consisting of contract, off-chain logic, and front-end components that should all be replicable locally for true decentralization. Emphasis on building open tooling as common knowledge base for developers.

topics.title: Distribution of Power and Security Through Time
topics.summary: Discussion of how crypto should be about power distribution, with proof of work representing fair distribution mechanisms. Emphasis on security being formed through research, implementation, and test of time rather than marketing hype.

topics.title: Privacy as Fundamental Right vs Control Systems
topics.summary: Warning about potential future where every economic transaction is audited and stored, creating unprecedented control systems. Critique of 'toy privacy' through ZK compliance systems versus real privacy and anonymity as fundamental requirements for censorship resistance.

topics.title: Asset Types and Regulatory Inclusion Challenges
topics.summary: Discussion of complexity around regulated vs non-regulated assets, bearer vs non-bearer assets, and custodial vs non-custodial systems. Mention of whitelist mechanisms as alternative to blacklist systems and upcoming bank collaboration on stablecoins.

topics.title: State Resistance as Core Value Proposition
topics.summary: Argument that state resistance is the only long-term value in cryptocurrency, as everything else will eventually centralize for efficiency. Discussion of resilience through open source tools and honest coordination within defined assumptions.

topics.title: Social Layer Toxicity and Clear Purpose
topics.summary: Critique of toxic social systems in crypto and emphasis on need for clear intent and purpose. Warning about potential dystopian future if privacy and resilience fail, and call for industry to mature around understanding control trade-offs and building wisely.
